data: Needs a community like fitbit. I feel no need to open the app because it feels like there's no real competition.

Excellent. Helps me reach my exercise goals each day. My only complaint is the voice used for Australia. The woman's voice sounds like she is positively BORED TO DEATH. Not exactly helpful when a bored and decidedly lethargic voice tells you you are "nearly there" with ZERO encouragement other than to say "you're nearly there" in the same voice which, frankly, would make many people just want to give up. Also, the voice says "duralation" instead of "duration". Ha ha, where on earth did that come from? But, as I said, apart from the voice used, is a great app in my Note 4 and will be sorry when the day comes to change phones, as I will be leaving Samsung, after a number of years, as I do not accept this new format with no changeable battery and no SD card. Sorry Samsung, you had the best products on the market, then wrecked it by copying that Apple trash.
